item.description:
Hi all,
I apologize for this late posting- I was unsure of my plans for this weekend. As part of their Music on Film series, the MFA is screening Sound of the Soul by Stephen Olsson (2005, 68 min.) this Sunday at 10:30 am. These early morning MFA films- you either got to love 'em or hate 'em! This documentary is rather short and may serve well as an introduction to a variety of music sensibilities. It also seems like a great way to start the day!

Sound of the Soul transports viewers on an exhilarating cinematic journey to North Africa. The film begins with the historic city of Fez: its heritage of tolerance as an ancient sanctuary for Muslim, Jewish, and Christian inhabitants; its Islamic foundations; and evocative medieval sites. It is the ideal location for an exceptional festival bringing together a unique array of musicians: a transcendent chorus of African Berber women, a Portuguese Fado singer; a French early music ensemble; players and vocalists from Afghanistan, England, Russia, Ireland, Mauritania, and Turkey; and a gospel band from Harlem. All are blended with unforgettable Moroccan Sufi performers and connected through their artistry by profound expressions of love and longing. MFA description

Not really any true 'reviews' for this film, but here is a link providing a further description: http://intermediasrev...

Since this event is only a few days away, you can only RSVP Yes.

And as is the custom, Tom will be holding a Meet-Up sign near the front row and then its off to a local restaurant to discuss.

Hope to see you there,
Tom
